worldCreator

public static World worldCreator(java.io.File gameWorldFile)
                          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                 CorruptFileException
Parses the map file, creating all the map entities, the map itself and validating the data received.

Parameters:
gameWorldFile - a String containing the World name.
Throws:
CorruptFileException - if the file is invalid
java.io.FileNotFoundException - if an IOError occurs
See Also:
jdungeon.parser.getWorldList

getWorldList

public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getWorldList()
                                                    throws NoMapsInFolderException
Wrapper function for worldList, gives worldList the directory from where it has to obtain the worlds name.

Returns:
Set
Throws:
NoMapsInFolderException - if there are no maps or no valid maps in the resources folder

worldList

public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> worldList(java.io.File worldDir)
                                                 throws NoMapsInFolderException
Parses all .board files in the resources folder, obtaining the Worlds names.It stores a link between the file and the World name returns a Set with the names of the Worlds. If there are 2 maps with the same name, it will only register the first one

Returns:
Set
Throws:
NoMapsInFolderException - if there are no maps or no valid maps in the resources folder
